DataElement.preferredName: Speech Oral Mechanism/Cranial Nerve Examination for Young Children Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The exchange of spoken words._A clinical protocol developed for the purpose of assessing the oral and speech motor abilities of children. The protocol can be administered in 7-10 minutes, and a child's performance can be compared to developmental norms._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: This is a thorough examination of a child's oral structures and functions that are necessary for speech production. It is designed to be administered in conjunction with, or as follow-up to, speech sound testing. Atypical observations may be used to identify the cause of speech disorders. For instance, deficits in neuromuscular functions during this protocol could confirm dysarthria, and deficits in motor planning could confirm apraxia of speech. The orofacial measures include observations of the structures and functionality of the facial muscles, lips, tongue, and jaw. Some speech productions are also assessed, but note that this protocol does not evaluate speech sound production systematically. Instead, other protocols such as the Goldman-Fristoe Test of Articulation 3 are designed to assess speech sound production. If abnormal structure or function is observed, closer examination by a clinician or specialist is required.
